pages.text: These creatures can be found in hot and dry places such as the desert or mesa. Some desert creatures will induce hunger effects as well as weakness.
Aggressive giant scorpions with a hunger inducing venom.$(br2)Can be summoned. Drops $(item)Flint$(), $(item)Iron Ore$(), $(item)Gold Nugget$(), $(item)Spider Eye$().

Deep under the desert sands, these giant worms dig around listening for prey, once they find their victim, they rise up from the ground and strike with a powerful bite. $(thing)Crusks$() have a large amount of health but aren't too fast to outrun, they also don't do well in small spaces and can't dig through solid rock or walls.$(br2)$(thing)Baby Crusks$() can be tamed. Drops $(item)Flint$(), $(item)Clay$(), $(item)Iron Ore$(), $(item)Gold Ore$().

$(thing)Baby Crusks$() can be tamed by luring them and feeding them $(item)Crusk Treats$() and can be healed by feeding them any cooked meat. Large Adult $(thing)Crusks$() will attack you on sight as normal and can't be tamed.

Metallic life forms with a rusty, rocky outer shell. $(thing)Clinks$() are able to grow metal blades onto the edge of their arms and then flick slices of the blades at their enemies. Take heed if you hear their metallic cries.$(br2)Can be summoned. Drops $(item)Throwing Scythe$(), $(item)Iron Ingot$().

Complex animals that are native to hot, dry areas. $(thing)Jousts$() are herd animals and come in two forms: Standard $(thing)Joust$()'s are passive but will bite back if attacked. $(thing)Alpha Jousts$() (larger, wider crest, brightly colored) are rarer but very dangerous and will attack on sight, any nearby Standard $(thing)Jousts$() will herd towards them and will attack what they attack. $(thing)Alpha Jousts$() are very territorial and will duel with each other for land, ignoring anything else nearby.

Can be bred. Drops $(item)Raw Joust Meat$() (Cooked if burning).$(br2)Non-alpha $(thing)Jousts$() can be lured and bred with $(item)Cactus Green Dye$(), baby Jousts will sometimes grow into Alphas so be careful!

Wild insect-like rock creatures that roam hot and dry terrain. $(thing)Erepedes$() can be very dangerous creatures. They like to hunt $(thing)Jousts$() and will attack $(thing)Crusks$() on sight too. $(thing)Erepedes$() spit out a dangerous mud shot that weakens the target.$(br2)Can be tamed and used as mount. Drops $(item)Flint$(), $(item)Mudshot Charge$().

Tamed $(thing)Erepedes$() can be used as mounts, you must equip them with a saddle first. $(thing)Erepede$() mounts are immune to cactus damage and also prevent the rider from being weakened. Using their ability will cause them to shoot mud shots where you are aiming (press $(k:Mount Ability) to use this ability once mounted). They also run much faster across sand when mounted.

Small rock beetles that are never alone! They can be killed easily but will quickly summon allies to help them, so kill them fast! They also have a 10% chance to summon an ally on death!$(br2)Drops $(item)Sandstone$(), $(item)Stone$(), $(item)Flint$(), $(item)Iron Ore$().

Vicious bat-like beasts with scorpion like tails. Their sting will leave you feeling very weak and hungry! They like to hunt down $(thing)Gorgomites$() and other small prey.$(br2)Can be summoned. Drops $(item)Flint$(), $(item)Stone$(), $(item)Iron Ore$().

At night, $(thing)Crypt Zombies$() crawl up from deep under the desert sands to stalk the night. $(thing)Crypt Zombies$() act like regular Zombies but don't burn in daylight and their attacks will cause fatigue making you hungry. Like regular Zombies, on Hard Difficulty, $(thing)Crypt Zombies$() will break down doors and will convert villagers.$(br2)Drops $(item)Rotten Flesh$(), $(item)Gold Nugget$().
